Package runtime

Class SML_Executor

java.lang.Object
runtime.SML_Executor
public class SML_Executor extends Object
An Executor for machine code. It defines the static method execute which loads machine-code instructions, executes them and outputs the results. The Executor is stateless meaning that no information is stored between executions and that an instance of an Executor is not necessary to execute a program. Before each call to execute the Executor is automatically reset.

The execution uses Requirements in order to specify different parameters. They can be obtained with the getRequriements() method, which contains more information about each individual Requirement.

Author:
Alex Mandelias

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(String[] args)
      Uses the command line arguments to specify the parameters necessary to execute a machine-code program, and then executes it. Parameters starting with a single dash '-' are set to true. Parameters starting with a double dash '--' are set to whatever the next argument is.

      The different parameters are documented in the getRequirements() method.

      Parameters:
      args - the command line arguments

    • getRequirements

      public static requirement.util.Requirements getRequirements()
      Returns the Requirements needed for execution. They have their default values and can be used as-is for execution. 
       | Value   | Default | Explanation          | Command Line |
 |---------|---------|----------------------|--------------|
 | input   | out.sml | "stdin" or filename  | --           |
 | output  | res.txt | "stdout" or filename | --           |
 | screen  | false   | output to stdout too | -            |
 | verbose | false   | output all messages  | -            |
      Returns:
      the Requirements

    • streams

      public static StreamSet streams()
      Returns a StreamSet that can be passed as a parameter to construct an Executor. The StreamSet can be configured with different input, output and error Streams for the Executor to use instead of the "standard" in, out and err Streams of the System class.
      Returns:
      the StreamSet
      See Also:
      StreamSet

    • execute

      public void execute​(requirement.util.Requirements requirements)
      Uses the parameters from the requirements in order to load the program, execute it and output the results.

      The different Requirements are documented in the getRequirements() method.

      Parameters:
      requirements - the parameters needed to compile
